Body: OK I got the purpose and goal of oneM2M is to develop technical specifications which address the need for a common M2M Service Layer that can be readily embedded within various hardware and software
column9:
and relied upon to connect the myriad of devices in the field with M2M application servers worldwide." for oneM2M.

And om2m is "The OM2M project
column11: is an open source implementation of the ETSI M2M standard. It provides a horizontal M2M service platform for developing services independently of the underlying network
column12:
with the aim to facilitate the deployment of vertical applications and heterogeneous devices."

my questions: 1) Is om2m (open source project) based on oneM2M standard ? 2) Is there any project developing/ed based on oneM2M standard ?

Thank you.

"

Body:
OM2M is based on ETSI standard (European Telecommunications Standards Institute) for M2M now called smartM2M. But ETSI is one the founder of OneM2M initiative. So you will find a lot of ideas and principle of smartM2M inside OneM2M. We estimate at LAAS-CNRS that the overlap is around 70 to 80%. So OM2M is not far away from OneM2M standard. The first official version of OneM2M standard will be publisher in january 2015. We will do a first demonstration of OM2M with OneM2M partial implementation in december 2014 with other partners at the launch event of OneM2M.

Thierry Monteil co-founder of OM2M LAAS-CNRS
Thank you, I also talked with Mahdi, he also gave some informations. Thank You both.

hi, I am also starting to do a project about developing M2M Applications based on ETSI standard. I also use OM2M as horizontal service platform. Right now I am looking for some documentation about the General concept for OM2M fit to OneM2M ETSI standard. Could you recommend me some documentations about this? Thank you so much
@Sonn have you developed the application based on onem2m?
